У вас пока нет MCP серверов: You don't have any MCP servers yet
mcpClientTooltip: Select the client who will own this MCP server. Available to administrators only.
mcpServerNameTooltip: A unique name to identify the MCP server. Used in the server list and when linking to assistants.
mcpServerUrlTooltip: The full URL of the MCP server, including the protocol (https://) and path. Example: https://mcp-server.example.com/sse
mcpTransportTooltip: The connection protocol. HTTP (SSE) — standard mode via Server-Sent Events. WebSocket — bidirectional real-time communication.
mcpAuthTypeTooltip: The authentication method for connecting to the MCP server. Choose 'None' if the server does not require authentication, or specify the desired type.
mcpBearerTokenTooltip: The authorization token sent in the Authorization: Bearer <token> header. Usually provided during registration or in MCP server settings.
mcpApiKeyTooltip: An API key to authorize requests to the MCP server. Sent in a request header to identify the client.
mcpCustomHeadersTooltip: Custom HTTP headers added to every request. Use for non-standard auth schemes or to pass metadata.
mcpConnectionTooltip: Manage the connection to the MCP server. Connect to access its tools and sync the list of available tools.
mcpToolsCardTooltip: List of tools available on this MCP server. Enable or disable individual tools and click to view details.
mcpToolStatusTooltip: The current state of the tool. Enabled tools are available for use by assistants.
mcpInputSchemaTooltip: JSON schema of the parameters this tool accepts. Defines the structure and types of input data.
mcpPoliciesTooltip: Security policies for this tool. Use to limit call frequency, block parameters, or require approval before execution.
mcpFunctionPreviewTooltip: Preview of the function definition in the format sent to the language model. Shows how the tool will be presented to the assistant API.
Выберите сервис для быстрого подключения: Choose a service to connect via OAuth
template_gmail_desc: Send and read emails, manage drafts and labels
template_google_calendar_desc: Manage events, find free time slots
composio_disconnect_confirm: Are you sure you want to disconnect this Composio service? The linked MCP server will be deleted.
composio_readonly_info: This server is managed via Composio and cannot be edited manually.
composio_test_no_params: This tool does not require parameters
api_key_instruction: Enter the Bot Token or API key to connect this service.
telegram_chat_id_step2: 2. Press «Start» or send /start — the bot will reply with your Chat ID. Paste it below.
template_bitrix24_desc: CRM: leads, contacts, deals and activities
bitrix24_webhook_step1: 1. Open Bitrix24 → Developer resources → Inbound webhook (Other → REST API → Inbound webhook).
bitrix24_webhook_step2: 2. Create a webhook with "CRM" permissions and copy the URL. Paste it below.
oauth_success_subtitle: The service has been connected. This window will close automatically.
